instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message:
Just got this one today. Turns on, chimes but I get no video. I can see the backlight turning on but the screen remains dark. Any idea on what is going on with this one?
There is no sign of water damage.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Voltage on pin 4 from J9000????

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: I get nothing, 0V

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Check L9008, i bet it is open......

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: L9008 measures 0 ohms

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: I also get 0V on pin 1-3 on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> so I guess the problem lays earlier in the circuit.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Sorry, my bad, I get 3,3v on pin1-3 on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: did you measure voltage on both sides of L9008?? I still think  L9008 is bad or broken trace....

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Yes, but what I am missing is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: do you have voltage on any pin of L9008??

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Something is trolling me here, now I suddenly get 3.3 on either side of L9008

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: And 3.3 on pin 4 og J9000

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: so, it is working now????

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: No, still black with backlight on

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Voltage on pin 2-3 from J9000??

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: I get 0V on pin 2 and 3

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Okei, I'm getting really confused here. A minute ago I could swear I got 3.3 on pin one of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. I probably did something wrong. It seems pin one of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is my main issue at the moment, I get 0V here

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Check L9080, 2 coils on 1 package...

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Yes, that was my next move

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: have you inspected lvds connector closely?? Your tests are with known working screen and lvds cable??

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Yes the LVDS connector at least looks fine. I have now replaced L9004, L9008 and L9080 with no luck. I have tried three different displays with three different cables. Maybe I should try to replace the LVDS connector next just in case?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: And I do have voltage on pin 2, 3 and 4 on J9000

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: Are you using a proper LCD or that LP133WX2-TLGV junk?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: I only have original screens.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes, backlight on but screen remains black/dark grey
threads.message: So I have an update here, even if it showed no sign of damage at all it was the LVDS connector itself, replaced it and all good :). Thank you for putting me in the right direction.
